<@U08GFT5V5> :taco:
Hi, in `Retrofit2`, how can you get the `httpClient` ?
`retrofit.client();` —> this one works fine in `Retrofit1`
Any reason why?
From what I know retrofit 2 doesn't store httpClient as OKHttpClient
instead it store httpclient as OKHttp's call factory
You can try to call callFactory() to get it
And turns out I'm right -> <https://github.com/square/retrofit/issues/1683>

attachments.title: How to get OkhttpClient Object in retrofit · Issue #1683 · square/retrofit · GitHub
attachments.text: How to get OkhttpClient Object in retrofit just like OkHttpClient okHttpClient = retrofit.client() in beta2
attachments.fallback: GitHub: How to get OkhttpClient Object in retrofit · Issue #1683 · square/retrofit

text: oh ok… then, cast to `OkHttpClient` ?
yes you can do that I think

porting old codes `Retrofit1` to `Retrofit2`

Hey guys, I am learning about architectures and I am wondering do I have to implement clean architecture if my application is not that complex. Is MVP enough ? I only have couple of api calls ... Is it ok to put retrofit's callbacks inside presenters?
<@U0XJ96KPG>: A couple of questions to ask
1 - is it worth the effort
2 - will I need to maintain it later
1 - Am I trying to learn something
If any of those is a yes. Time to play for MVP
1. As I read a lot about clean, I think it is nice. BUT I do not need db in my project, just fetching some data from server.  So I think I do not need whole Clean arch
2. Yes
3. Always eager to learn something new
I need answer for this: Is it ok to put retrofit's callbacks inside presenters? Is it ok to NOT have interactors?
thanks <@U08GFT5V5>
I call that clean-ish and works most of the time

hello
I am wondering as to what would be the right approach to interact between my collapsing toolbar and the activity's inner fragment.
the page to be seen is dictated by the activity's current fragment, however, the page's title is dictated by the activity's collapsing toolbar. even more so since the collapsing toolbar hosts text *and image*.

I was wondering, then, how should I let the fragment dictate the activity's toolbar content?
should I supply some public methods for the fragment to access?
or is there a better approach perhaps?
Interface

anyone have experience with the API 23 app links? I see in my logcat after installing that the verification was succesful, however when via ADB I execute "adb shell dumpsys package domain-preferred-apps”, i get a listing telling me that my auto-verification status is undefined 

edit: unfortunately stackoverflow and google results seem very limited in offering any help
double edit: seems like as long as you notice that the verification was successful at install time, then the deep links will open your app without asking regardless of the auto-verification state listed by the above adb command.

Hi all where I can find an easy tutorial that shows how to take picture and store that picture  in sqlite database?
Why not try the udacity course
It has a chapter for SQLite.
1 note, do not store the picture in sqlite
save it to disk with a uuid for the name then use sqlite to store reference to it like image type, original name, etc
Avoid anything blob in SQL languages is what I would say
for a more solid reason of ‘why’ use this reference <https://www.sqlite.org/intern-v-extern-blob.html>
its also worth noting in android you have convenience methods (that are memory efficient) loading images from disk but not when loading them from a db

text: <@U21MN5Z0R|mshukla> has joined the channel

Did anyone here ever see an issue where `ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission()` would return „granted“ even tho the user actually revoked the permission? I have a call to the location API that uses this to check if the user granted the permission and mostly on some 6.0.1 devices this leads to a crash cause the permission is actually *not* granted...
It seems to only happen in some special cases tho which I just can’t reproduce :confused:
ew :confused:
anything related to the sharedprefs persisting between installs?
in my experience that’s the main reason for inconsistent behaviour
Hm, but nothing about those permissions is saved there. It’s really only that check
I was able to reproduce it once on my device but when I switched to the debug build it worked again :confused:
<@U053PPGDC>: Prefs file is save in the app data dir
it’s deleted when the app is uninstalled
Yes it's deleted but after lollipop it'll be backed up to the cloud by default
Change allowBackup to false can fix that
